It is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and small, bladder-like structures that aid in capturing prey. The plant thrives in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and ditches. Cyclosorus perrigidus is a carnivorous plant that uses its specialized bladders to trap and digest small aquatic organisms.
